title: Basic Usage
content: Set the upload service interface through the action attribute.
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: Custom Request Header
content: The headers attribute is used to customize the upload request header information.
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: Extra parameters attached during upload
content: The data attribute is used to customize the additional parameters attached to the upload.
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: Set Component Size
content: The options are as follows: medium, small, mini The disabled attribute is used to set whether to disable. The default value is false.
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: Override the default request
content: You can configure http-request to overwrite the default upload behavior and customize the upload implementation
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: Field name of the uploaded file
content: Use the upload-name attribute to set the field name of the file to be uploaded. The default value is file.
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: Send cookie credential information
content: For details, see the following example.
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: Text of the Cancel button in the dialog box for uploading files
content: Specify the text content of the cancel button through the cancel-button-text attribute
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: Text of the Submit button in the dialog box for uploading files
content: For details, see the following example.
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: Text of the button for opening a dialog box
content: For details, see the following example.
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: Maximum number of files to be uploaded
content: You can use the limit attribute to specify the maximum number of files to be uploaded. After the multiple attribute is configured, you can select multiple files at the same time.
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: File types that can be uploaded
content: The accept attribute can be used to control the file type when a file is selected, and the upload-file-type attribute can be used to specify the file type to be verified during upload.
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: Size of files that can be uploaded
content: The max-upload-file-size attribute specifies the size of the file that can be uploaded.
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: Do not delete files
content: :before-remove (callback event before removing a file). In the method, return true/false indicates whether the file can be deleted.
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.

title: Do not upload files
content: :before-upload Indicates the hook before uploading a file. The parameter is the uploaded file. If false is returned or Promise is returned and rejected, the upload stops.
findIntroStr: Click the element to display the upload dialog box.
